newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks in London end flat, lack ideas.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks in London end flat, lack ideas.

text.p: Japanese shares in London ended flat on Thursday in thin featureless trading.
The Nikkei/ISE 50 index stood at 1,601.28 points, up 0.71 points, by 1510 GMT.
Earlier the Nikkei 225 index shed it's opening gains to close 10 points or 0.05 percent down at 20,507.85 points as investors were said to stay away ahead of the looming G7 meeting in Denver.
"The market is lacking ideas," one trader said.
"The investors are sitting on the sidelines", another dealer added.
Apart from some activity in Nippon Telegraph & Telecom (NTT), Sony Corp and Honda Corp. 7267Q.L the market was reported to be very quiet.

NTT was trading at 1,095 yen, compared with a close of 1,080 yen in Tokyo. Sony stood at 9,750 yen versus a Tokyo close of 9,780. Honda was trading at 3,280 yen compared with a Tokyo finish of 3,240 yen.
